# Draft:Dioptra (software)

}}
Dioptra, Inc. (branded Dioptra AI) is an American legal technology company that develops software for AI-assisted contract review and redlining. The company’s tools are used by in-house legal teams and law firms to generate draft redlines in word-processing documents, flag issues against playbooks, and streamline negotiations.
History and founding
Dioptra was founded in 2021 by Pierre Arnoux, Jacques Arnoux, and Farah Gasmi.
The company participated in Y Combinator (Winter 2022 batch).
Technology and products
Dioptra's core offering is an AI agent that performs contract review and redlining within Microsoft Word documents. It attempts to mimic lawyer-level edits by referencing user playbooks, past contracts, and preferred fallback language.
Key features include:
* Redlining with AI in Word
* Playbook distillation from executed agreements
* Issue flagging and risk summaries
* Integration with contract lifecycle management (CLM) and enterprise workflows
* Data security compliance (SOC 2 Type II, encryption, etc.)
Partnerships and integrations
In April 2025, Dioptra announced an integration with LawVu, enabling contracts created in LawVu to be automatically sent to Dioptra for redlining and returned to the workspace as a new version.
In July 2025, contract-lifecycle-management provider Icertis and Dioptra announced a partnership to combine Icertis’ contract-specific AI with Dioptra’s redlining agent for enterprise customers.
Reception
Coverage by the legal-innovation publication Artificial Lawyer in 2024 reported Wilson Sonsini’s use of Dioptra as part of the firm’s Neuron program focused on startup clients, highlighting accuracy on contract review tasks.
